column3: Wilderland]], at the source of the [[Anduin]]

column1: '''Framsburg'''<ref group="note">The name and location of this town first appeared on [[Pauline Baynes]]' ''[[A Map of Middle-earth]]'' ([[1970]]).</ref> was the only fortified burg of the [[Éothéod]], the ancestors of the [[Rohirrim]], while they lived in the far north by the [[Grey Mountains]] between the rivers [[Greylin]] and [[Langwell]].<ref>{{UT
Framsburg was probably founded shortly after the Éothéod arrived in {{TA
column3: TA}}</ref> during the rule of [[Frumgar]], but it took its name from his son [[Fram]], the famed slayer of the [[Long-worms

column1: The burg was probably abandoned circa {{TA
column2: 2510}} when [[Eorl the Young]] led the Éothéod south to settle [[Calenardhon]], the land later known as [[Rohan]].<ref name="TA"/>
